sen.j: 野田川駅（のだがわえき）は、京都府与謝郡与謝野町字下山田小字柿内にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Nodagawa Station, located in Koaza Kakiuchi Aza Shimoyamada, Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the Miyazu Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Nodagawa Station, located in Koaza Kakiuchi Aza Shimoyamada, Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility of the Miyazu Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Nodagawa Station, located in Koaza Kakiuchi Aza Shimoyamada, Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility of the Miyazu Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）が運営していた時代は丹後山田駅（たんごやまだえき）と名乗っていたが、北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管の際に現在の駅名に改称されている（野田川町は与謝野町成立までの旧町名だった）。
sen.e: This station was called Tango Yamada Station while the line was operated by Japan National Railways and West Japan Railway Company (JR West), but it was renamed when the Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway (Nodagawa-cho was the old name of Yosano-cho).

This station was called Tango Yamada Station while the line was operated by Japan National Railways and the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), but it was renamed when the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway (Nodagawa-cho was the old name of Yosano-cho).

This station was called Tango Yamada Station while the line was operated by Japan National Railways and the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), but it was renamed when the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway (Nodagawa-cho was the old name of Yosano-cho).

sen.j: また、1985年まで、当駅～加悦（かや）間で加悦鉄道が運行されていた。
sen.e: Until 1985, Kaya Railway had been operating between this station and Kaya.
Until 1985, Kaya Railway operated between this station and Kaya.
Until 1985, Kaya Railway operated between this station and Kaya.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式・相対式2面3線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has an 2 platforms, an island-type platform and a separate-type platform, for 3 tracks.
This station is a ground station having two platforms--an island-type platform and a separate-type platform--to serve three tracks.
This station is a ground station having two platforms--an island-type platform and a separate-type platform--to serve three tracks.

sen.j: 土曜日・休日以外は夜にこの駅で折り返す列車がある。
sen.e: Some trains turn back at this station in the nighttime except on Saturday and holidays.
Some trains turn back at this station in the nighttime, except on Saturdays and holidays.
Some trains turn back at this station in the nighttime, except on Saturdays and holidays.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約271人である。
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 271 (based on the statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefecture).
The average daily number of passengers in 2006 was 271 (based on statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefecture).
The average daily number of passengers in fiscal year 2006 was 271.
sen.cmt: 括弧を削除しました。fiscal year としました。

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)

sen.j: 1925年7月31日：日本国有鉄道峰山線の宮津～丹後山田間の開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: July 31, 1925 - This station commenced operation when Miyazu～Tango Yamada section of the Mineyama Line, then operated by Japanese National Railways, came into operation.
July 31, 1925: The station was activated when the Miyazu～Tango Yamada section of the Mineyama Line, then operated by Japanese National Railways, became operational.
July 31, 1925: The station was activated when the Miyazu - Tango Yamada section of the Mineyama Line, then operated by Japan National Railways, became operational.
sen.cmt: ～→ハイフン にとしました。

sen.j: 1926年12月5日：加悦鉄道が開業。
sen.e: December 5, 1926 - Kaya Railway came into operation.
December 5, 1926: The Kaya Railway came into operation.
December 5, 1926: The Kaya Railway came into operation.

sen.j: 1932年8月10日：路線名改称により国鉄宮津線の駅に。
sen.e: August 10, 1932 - The station became the station of the Miyazu Line operated by Japanese National Railways due to the change of line name.
August 10, 1932: The station became a facility of the Miyazu Line, operated by Japanese National Railways, due to the change in the line name.
August 10, 1932: The station became a facility of the Miyazu Line, operated by Japan National Railways, due to the change in the line name.
sen.cmt: Japan National Railways としました。

sen.j: 1985年5月1日：加悦鉄道廃止。
sen.e: May 1, 1985 - Kaya Railway was abolished.
May 1, 1985: The Kaya Railway was abolished.
May 1, 1985: The Kaya Railway was abolished.

sen.j: 1987年4月1日：国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - The station became the station of JR West thanks to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a facility of JR West due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a facility of JR West due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1990年4月1日：北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅に。
sen.e: April 1, 1990 - The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway and accordingly, this station became its station.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and accordingly this station became one of its facilities.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and accordingly this station became one of its facilities.

sen.j: また、駅名を現在の野田川に改称
sen.e: At the same time, the station was renamed current Nodagawa Station.
At the same time, the station was renamed as Nodagawa Station.
At the same time, the station was renamed as Nodagawa Station.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
